intro: Geonoma macroclona, commonly known as the large-leaf geonoma, is a species of fern native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on trees or in dense undergrowth. Its foliage is not only ornamental but also plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
